artist: Utagawa Kunisada; Utagawa Hiroshige; Publisher: Iseya Kanekichi; Carver: Yokogawa Takejirō
markings: left sheet, red artist's seal: {Ichiryūsai} | date seal: 丑四 {ushi yon} (Ox 4) | censor seals: {Kinugasa}, 村田 {Murata} | carver's seal: 横川彫竹 {Yokogawa hori Take} | publisher's seal: 吉　伊勢兼 {Kichi, Isekane}
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e), ink and color on paper
portfolio: An Elegant Genji (Fūryū Genji 風流源氏)
signed: Right, in toshidama cartouche: 豊國画 {Toyokuni ga} | Left: 廣重画 {Hiroshige ga}
text: Two women on a balcony espy Mitsuuji walking through the reeds at Akashi Bay. Hiroshige later reused his landscape design for a triptych showing Kanazawa Bay in his Eight Views of Kanazawa Bay in Moonlight (Buyō Kanazawa hasshō yakei) from 1857.
title: Akashi
